curse.level: A Dance of Fire and Ice
curse.but: the judgement limits are changing
it is in another type of rhythm
each straight line makes you more laggy
curse.desc: You starts with N = 0. Every time you reached the end of a chain of 180° tiles, the tile right after the chain needs to hit N extra times; After that, N increased by 1.

curse.but: short
curse.desc: Remove segments at any scale.

curse.but: the april fools has come true
curse.desc: The planets are in the wrong orientation, yet the chart plays the exact same as it did before.

curse.but: there is a 1 beat PAUSE on every tile
curse.desc: Doubling the BPM and increasing paused beat counts by 1.

curse.but: every tile is doubled
curse.desc: Both ends of the track are excluded.

curse.but: each reflex angled tile will speed you up, and vice versa
every successive same-angled tile segments has 1 additional tile
curse.desc: 0° and 360° may also counts, it depends. This effect can also add or remove twirls without changing the rhythm for better readability.

curse.but: every tile that its angle isn't θτ/4 has a twirl on it (θ∈ℤ)
curse.desc: In case you don't know, τ = 360°, and τ/4 = 90°.

curse.but: no more reflex angles for you
curse.desc: Twirls will be added on tiles thats its angle is >180°. This effect can also add or remove twirls without changing the rhythm for better readability.

curse.but: the twirls can change your current speed
curse.desc: Red Twirl = Speed Up, Blue Twirl = Speed Down. Simple.

curse.but: the acute angles and the obtuse angles are swapped
curse.desc: The angle of each tile is now its supplementary angle. Integer multiples of 180° will bypass this curse. Angles >180° will be moduled by 180° when processing. This effect can also add or remove twirls without changing the rhythm for better readability.

curse.but: you found the shortcuts
curse.desc: If the center of two (or more) tiles was overlapped with each other, The planet will choose the shortest path in time (not in tile count) to walk on. If these shortest choices end up in a tie, you can choose any of them.

curse.but: it's tutorial exclusive
curse.desc: Replacing a segment to a tutorial level, or inserting one.

curse.but: this is a DLC level
curse.desc: Add DLC contents. Additionally, Hold can replace 180° tiles by extra loops, and midspins cannot be created out of nothing.

curse.but: the midspins are taking over this level
curse.desc: Replace some non-midspin tiles to midspin without changing the rhythm.

curse.but: each gameplay event is delayed by 1 tile
curse.desc:
This curse effect can only affects these type of events below:
Set Speed
Twirl
SCheckpoint
Hold
Multi Planet
Paused Beats
Timing Window Scale
Hide Judgement/Floor Icons (if as a part of gameplay)
AutoPlay tiles (if as a part of gameplay)
Set Conditional Events (if as a part of gameplay)
Set Input Event (if as a part of gameplay)

curse.but: each 90° tile should have a triangle
curse.desc: If and only if, any 90° tile wasn't a part of a right triangle, give it one.

curse.but: the multitaps has been changed to midspins
curse.desc: Any angle is acceptable for the midspins, except for those that cause the planet to spin extra loops.

curse.but: it's a three-body problem
curse.desc: Change the planet counts to 3, without changing the shape of the chart, and the duration for 180° tiles.

curse.but: i swapped the u-turns and the midspins
curse.desc: Continuously midspins is possible, and they will follow ADOFAI's default behavior.

curse.but: all the existence states of swirls on u-turns are inverted
curse.desc: For each 360° tiles, if there is no swirl on it, add one; otherwise remove the swirl.

curse.but: all the existence states of swirls on 180° tiles are inverted
curse.desc: For each 180° tiles, if there is no swirl on it, add one; otherwise remove the swirl.

curse.but: its curse effect is defined as the combination of XO-1 and XO-2
the planet would pause for 2 extra beats for each tile with icon on it, iff possible
all the straight tiles are missing
curse.desc: Planet will skip them, rather than waiting.

curse.but: it is in the "midspin not found" state
curse.desc: Replace every midspin to non-midspin tiles, without changing the rhythm.

curse.but: the time of notes in each beat is rounded
curse.desc: "beats" can also be section, 2 beats, etc. Notes that span multiple parts belongs to the first part, and it's a normal phenomenon that some of the part has no notes in them.

curse.but: after you meet a tile thats >180° the speed should be doubled compared to tiles <180°
curse.desc: The speed can also be doubled or halved when curse effect starts for difficulty balancing.

curse.but: every hold is now with 0 extra loops
curse.desc: Add holds if there is no holds, then changes every hold to have 0 extra loops.

curse.but: every hold is now 1 loop longer
curse.desc: Add holds if there is no holds, then add 1 extra loops to every hold.

curse.but: the special midspins can change the speed
curse.desc: Fire Midspin = Speed Up, Ice Midspin = Speed Down.

curse.but: the special midspins can change the planet count
curse.desc: Fire Midspin = Triple Planets, Ice Midspin = Double Planets, "Yellow" Midspin = Swap To Another Count For Planets.
Remove uncertain factors, such as free roam.

curse.but: it's a midspin party
curse.desc: Add some special midspins, and change the existing midspins to special variants.

curse.but: the midspins are from australia
curse.desc: For every tile with midspins, flip the midspins to another side in the original (not reversed) order and the same ratio. For example, a midspin that divided the angle equally, should also divide the angle equally on the other side.

curse.but: its curse can change the description of any curse effect
curse.desc:
T5-X is a curse-to-curse mapping which takes three parameters:
the curse effect that will be modified
the old substring to be replaced
the new substring to be used for replacement
and return a new (and temporary) curse effect with the replaced curse effect introduction.
